title: Incremental compilation ICE with `predicates_of`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Anyone encountering this issue (or an issue linked here) can run either `cargo clean` or `cargo clean -p <your_package_name>` as a temporary workaround.

Since https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/83007 was merged, we now ICE during incremental compilation when the hash of a re-computed query result does not match the hash from a previous session.

There have been a very large number of bug reports, all involving `predicates_of`:
* https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/84336
* https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/84237
* https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/84116

There are several common characteristics across these issues
* All of them involve calling `predicate_of` on a trait from *the standard library*, not user code.
* All of them involve remapped paths pointing into the local standard library source code.

I've been able to reproduce similar crashes to these by adding or removing the `rust-src` component between  compilation sessions
